net.openhft.chronicle.network.ssl

Interface BufferHandler

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    BytesBufferHandler

    public interface BufferHandler
    This class handles the bridge between two sets of buffers: - socket-side data - encrypted, handled by readData, writeData - application-side data - decrypted, handled by handleDecryptedData

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void handleDecryptedData(ByteBuffer input, ByteBuffer output)
      Accept decrypted input data, previous collected by an invocation of readData.
      int readData(ByteBuffer target)
      Read encrypted data from an input into the supplied buffer.
      int writeData(ByteBuffer encrypted)
      Write encrypted data to an output from the supplied buffer.

    • Method Detail

      • readData

        int readData(ByteBuffer target)
      throws IOException
        Read encrypted data from an input into the supplied buffer.
        Parameters:
        target - the target buffer for encrypted data
        Returns:
        the number of bytes written
        Throws:
        IOException - if an exception occurs

      • handleDecryptedData

        void handleDecryptedData(ByteBuffer input,
                         ByteBuffer output)
        Accept decrypted input data, previous collected by an invocation of readData. Any plain-text output should be written to the output buffer for encryption.
        Parameters:
        input - a buffer containing decrypted input data
        output - a buffer that can be used for writing plain-text output

      • writeData

        int writeData(ByteBuffer encrypted)
       throws IOException
        Write encrypted data to an output from the supplied buffer.
        Parameters:
        encrypted - the buffer containing encrypted data
        Returns:
        the number of bytes written
        Throws:
        IOException - if an exception occurs
